intro: Meteorina gracilipes, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds known for their milky sap. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Meteorina gracilipes is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
